#summary Arrow Directions

= Description =

Demo of the different arrow directions that dot supports.

= Code =

{{{
            return Fluently.CreateDirectedGraph()
                .Nodes.Add(nodes =>
                               {
                                   nodes.WithName("a");
                                   nodes.WithName("b");
                                   nodes.WithName("c");
                                   nodes.WithName("d");
                                   nodes.WithName("e");
                                   nodes.WithName("f");
                                   nodes.WithName("g");
                                   nodes.WithName("h");
                               })
                .Edges.Add(edges =>
                               {
                                   edges.From.NodeWithName("a").To.NodeWithName("b")
                                       .WithArrowDirection(ArrowDirection.Back)
                                       .WithLabel("Back");
                                   edges.From.NodeWithName("c").To.NodeWithName("d")
                                       .WithArrowDirection(ArrowDirection.Both)
                                       .WithLabel("Both");
                                   edges.From.NodeWithName("e").To.NodeWithName("f")
                                       .WithArrowDirection(ArrowDirection.Forward)
                                       .WithLabel("Forward");
                                   edges.From.NodeWithName("g").To.NodeWithName("h")
                                       .WithArrowDirection(ArrowDirection.None)
                                       .WithLabel("None");
                               });

}}}

{{{

"c" -> "d" [dir="both", label="Both"];
"e" -> "f" [dir="forward", label="Forward"];
"g" -> "h" [dir="none", label="None"];

}
